intro: Tryphostemma nummularium, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, silver-velvet leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of flowering vines and herbs. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found along rocky slopes and in open woodlands. Its rapid growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
